column2: Pershing Square offers slate for Allergan board July 7 William Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management proposed on Monday a slate of six directors for the board of Allergan Inc as the hedge fund presses forward with its $53 billion takeover bid with Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  for the Botox maker.

column2: Taiwan stocks give investors a juicier bite of Apple Inc TAIPEI
column3: July 7 Investors wanting a slice of the crazy demand expected for Apple Inc's next version of the iPhone are rushing for what they believe is more profitable than investing in the U.S. smartphone maker: Taiwanese Apple component suppliers.

column2: ADM buys ingredients company Wild Flavors for about $3 billionCORRECTED-UPDATE 1-ADM buys ingredients company Wild Flavors for about $3 billionUPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets  UPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets (Corrects currency in paragraph 1 to $136 million from euros)UPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets   CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-ADM buys ingredients company Wild Flavors for about $3 billionUPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets  UPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets (Corrects currency in paragraph 1 to $136 million from euros)UPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets  July 7 Archer Daniels Midland (ADM) said it is buying food flavors and specialty ingredients company Wild Flavors for 2.2 billion euros ($3 billion) in cash and will assume about 0.1 billion euros of net debt.CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-ADM buys ingredients company Wild Flavors for about $3 billionUPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets  UPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets (Corrects currency in paragraph 1 to $136 million from euros)UPDATE 5-U.S. agribusiness ADM to acquire Wild Flavors for $3 bln * Gives ADM access to growing flavouring and health markets

column2: BlackRock team to tap growing UK local government pensions market LONDON
column5: said on Monday it had set up a special team to service growing demand from its UK local government pension schemes (LGPS) clients.

column2: Canada's WestJet Airlines to fly wide-body aircraft TORONTO
column5: said on Monday it planned to fly its own wide-body planes as early as the autumn of 2015 and was in advanced stages of sourcing the aircraft
column6: a move that heats up competition with larger rival Air Canada.

column2: Greenpeace activists block Chevron shale site in Romania PUNGESTI
column4: July 7 Greenpeace activists chained themselves to the gates of a Chevron shale gas exploration well in eastern Romania on Monday
column5: blocking access to the site and urging the leftist government to ban fracking.

column2: Expedia says to pay $660 mln for Australia's WotifUPDATE 1-Expedia to pay $660 mln for Australian online travel agency Wotif * Wotif struggling with weak hotel bookings
column3: increased competition  UPDATE 1-Expedia to pay $660 mln for Australian online travel agency Wotif * Wotif struggling with weak hotel bookings
column5: July 7 U.S. travel giant Expedia Inc  said on Monday it agreed to buy Australian online travel group Wotif.com Holdings Ltd for A$703 million ($660 million) in cash
column6: sending Wotif's shares 25 percent higher.UPDATE 1-Expedia to pay $660 mln for Australian online travel agency Wotif * Wotif struggling with weak hotel bookings

column5: July 7 One team of researchers assessing the risks of electronic cigarettes is counting the puffs taken by volunteer "vapers." Another will comb Facebook for posts on how people are tinkering with e-cigarettes to make the devices deliver extra nicotine. A third is building a virtual convenience store for 13-to-17-year-olds
column6: measuring how e-cigarette displays and price promotions influence whether minors buy the increasingly popular devices.

column2: GM says June China auto sales up 9.1 pct y/yGM to invest $270 million in Argentine factory -government BUENOS AIRES
